Package poised

Class Project

java.lang.Object
poised.Project
Direct Known Subclasses:
EditAndFinaliseProject
public class Project extends Object
Parent class that captures and edits the information to create an instance of a Project. It is inherited by the EditAndFinaliseProject subclass which contains the methods associated with editing a field of a Project object and finalising the project. Project attributes include an object of each of the Manager, Engineer, Architect and Customer subclasses.
Author:
Megan Bisschoff
See Also:

  • Method Details

    • getProjNumber

      public String getProjNumber()
      The 'getter' and 'setter' methods gets and sets the values of the projNumber, projName, projType, projAddress, projErf, feeTotal, feePaid, projDeadline, projFinalised and projCompletionDate fields for the Project objects.
      Returns:
      the projects number, name, building type, address, ERF number, fee total, fee paid, deadline, finalisation status and completion date.

    • getCustomer

      public Person getCustomer()
      The 'getter' and 'setter' methods gets and sets the values of the customer, architect, engineer and engineer fields for the Architect, Customer, Engineer and Manager subclass objects.
      Returns:
      the full name, contact number, email and address for each subclass object.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Prints string of each Project attribute. Method includes the Manager, Engineer, Architect and Customer subclasses toString method.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      output A formatted string of the projects's number, name, type, address, ERF number, fee total, fee paid, deadline and completion date together with the customer, architect and contractors details about the project.

    • captureProject

      public void captureProject(Project newPoiseProject, List<Project> projectList)
      Captures, validates and sets information to create a new Project object. Prompts the user for input and sets the project number setProjNumber, building type setProjType, project address setProjAddress, ERF number setProjErf, total fee setFeeTotal, fee paid setFeePaid, and project deadline setProjDeadline.

      Input is requested until the user input is validated for each object field not being equal to "none", 0 or null as set in the objects attributes.

      Parameters:
      newPoiseProject - a new project object created by the empty constructor.
      Throws:
      SQLException

    • createProjectName

      public void createProjectName(Project newPoiseProject, Person projectCustomer)
      Creates and sets a project name projName if the object feild is empty or equals to the "none" value initialised in the objects attributes. It combines the property type with the customer last name, retreived from the second word/index of the customers fullname.
      Parameters:
      newPoiseProject - Project object
      projectCustomer - Customer object
